definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Bob: Yes, he only had an adopted child.
She constantly abused her adopted son for no reason. Even the neighbors couldn't stand it.
sentences.chinese: 她經常無緣無故詬詈養子，鄰居們都看不慣了。

sentences.english: And he points to his adopted son as evidence for that.
sentences.chinese: 他指着他的養子作爲證據。

sentences.english: His adopted son went abroad last week.

definition: to plot a rebellion/to conspire against the state
to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
